page.title: 11WORK AROUND WIRKSWORTH
page.content: SOURCES OF EMPLOYMENT WITHIN THE AREA. LORRY DRIVING, FARMING, CLOTHING MANUFACTURE, RIBBON MAKING, OFFICE WORK, EDUCATION, HEALTH, SHOPS, PUBLIC HOUSES, SPORTS CENTRE, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, THE WATER AUTHORITY TUNNEL. MANY PEOPLE TRAVEL TO THEIR WORK OUT OF THE AREA. BRITISH RAIL, ROLLS ROYCE IN DERBY, DERBYSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL, WEST DERBYSHIRE DISTRICT COUNCIL IN MATLOCK, BUT PRINCIPALLY QUARRYING FOR LIMESTONE WITH ITS TRANSPORTATION LINKS TO THE NORTH OF WIRKSWORTH. ONLY ONE MILL IN THE AREA NOW PRODUCES RIBBON IN SOUTH WIRKSWORTH. NO LEAD MINES ARE NOW IN OPERATION. THE MINERAL RAILWAY IS NOW USED ONLY RARELY FOR CARRYING LIMESTONE. ONE FIRM RUNNING 200 LORRIES CLOSED DOWN IN 1983.
